intro: Aster marginatus, commonly known as the Margined Aster, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive white or pale green margin. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, arranged in dense clusters at the top of the stems. Aster marginatus is often found in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
